title: Do you have good handwriting? If so, did you practice for it to be that way? - Quora

response.answer_text: Yes, I have good handwriting (or, printing, really). When I was young, my mom’s best friend had a son my age and he was getting awards for “penmanship.” He attended the local Christian school while I was homeschooled. Yeah, I had a weird childhood. Anyway, my mom and his mom were talking about these awards he got and my mom was congratulating her, gushing really. I was a precocious child and I was immediately annoyed by this. I wanted to be the best. I decided that I was going to improve my handwriting so that I would win awards for penmanship if such awards existed for homeschool. So I did. My cursive still sucks though. I only worked on my printing.

No I don't it's part of my stealth DYSLEXIA it's call disgraphia it's allways been that way keeping my of the honor roll when in grade school. That is what caused me to be A REBEL. Starting in the 3rd GRADE.

Thanks for the A2A Personally, although I am in high school, I have a cursive handwriting most of the time because I have practiced and because of my growing fountain pen usage. I have wrote only cursive for months and have indeed worked hard for it to be like this. Hope this helps
I have good handwriting, my mother has good handwriting, beautiful, I got it from her.. Regards, Dia
